poem:
### The Headlines at Breakfast

The ink spills across the page,  
like a shadow of old fears—  
talk of war echoing down  
cereal aisles, as morning brews  
in coffee cups, steam rising  
like uncertain futures.  
Outside, sparrows dance  
on power lines, mocking  
our man-made prophecies  
of ruin with a simple song.
